This country is definately heading the wrong way with this taxation debate. While the government talks of austerity measures, her actions have repeatedly proven hypocritical. Alot of non-issues are availed to us and where narrow interests seem to subdue the larger course for reasonable debates. If you have happened to notice, leaders charged with responsibilities of serving are busy building a patron-client system right under our noses. A system based on loots and peculiar connections instead of meritocracy, trust and hard work. It happens that you will see them inviting their followers to indulge in expensive alcohol quench in their newly acquired masions and villas in Karen and Loresho etc. Coming back to the tax debate which a few analysts have labled as a horrible decisions by the current regime, decisions largely dictated by an appetite of a government that wants to collect more but one that doesnt want to be held on account of its spending. The debate on taxation has seen people and industries driving the economy crying faul. But this debate is an easier one as the government can (if they want to) mobilize compromises and support to gain a common ground. What is however missing in these debates is what in real sense the government would wants to do with these funds, and the honesty in their intention (see YouTube interview videos of Jimmy Wanjigi to understand where I am coming from. As we speak in general, we have saddening stories for instance over 500,000 pupils cannot access schools because of the aftermath of floods. This is politically a non issue. Businesses are closing down not only because of the costs of staying afloat but also because of a significant reduction of local consumer purchasing power. Politically, this seems not to be an issue. Corruption makes it hard to start and sustain small bussineses, and where funds collected are diverted into private pockets with full impunity. Again politically, this also seems not to be problem. Peharps the issue appear largely to be about ‚Ä¶plunder and tax them more, collect more and then plunder further! When you have so many pressing issues to address as government every shilling collected must be spent in prudence. So I thought! #DemocraticSpacesDictates!

Exploring the Essentials of Taxation in a Modern Economy: Taxation plays a crucial role in our economy, serving two primary purposes: funding government expenditure and influencing domestic economic management. Additionally, it serves as a tool to achieve various social objectives, impacting wealth distribution and encouraging specific behaviors. The UK tax system is designed to: 1. Incentivize individual savings and pension provision through tax incentives. 2. Support charitable donations via schemes like gift aid. 3. Encourage entrepreneurship and investment with targeted tax reliefs. Conversely, it discourages certain behaviors, such as motoring (fuel duties) and smoking/drinking (imposing taxes). Moreover, taxation policies contribute to "Green" initiatives, addressing climate change and promoting sustainability. Understanding the broader impact of taxation requires considering both direct and indirect taxes. Direct taxes, like income tax and corporation tax, are levied on income and capital transfers, while indirect taxes, such as VAT, are applied to goods and services.
